snpGeneSets 2.0
  • Reference

Get gene sets of a MSigDB gene-set category

setType2setID.Rd

'setType2setID' gets all gene sets/pathways belonging to a gene-set category.

Usage

setType2setID(setType, setSize = NULL)

Arguments

setType

'setType' is a integer or numeric value of gene-set category at [0,20]. The complete list of 'setType' can be obtained by function 'getSetType'.

setSize

The 'setSize' is a integer or numeric vector, which specifies the size of gene set/pathway, and only a gene set/pathway that contains the number of genes defined by 'setSize' will be returned. The default value is 'NULL', which removes the restriction of 'setSize' for gene sets, and all gene sets of the category will be returned.

Details

For a given gene-set category ('setType'), the 'setType2setID' function will search the local integrated MSigDB and identify those gene sets/pathways with the size of 'setSize'.

Value

The 'setType2setID' function will return an integer vector of gene-set/pathway IDs that belong to the 'setType' and have 'setSize' number of genes.

References

Author

H Mei; L Li

Note

See also

setID2setType, getGeneSetInfo, getSetType

Examples

# setType2setID(setType=7,setSize=9:10)
